newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea foreign debt rises to $104.5 bln in 1996.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea foreign debt rises to $104.5 bln in 1996.

text.p: South Korea's total foreign debt rose to a provisional $104.5 billion at the end of 1996 from $78.4 billion a year earlier, the Bank of Korea said on Thursday.
The central bank said in a statement the country's net foreign debt, which excludes assets abroad totalling $69.8 billion at end-1996, stood at a provisional $34.7 billion.
South Korea held $61.4 billion worth of assets abroad at the end of 1995, it said.
The central bank said the total foreign debt accounted for 21.8 percent of the nation's gross national product, up from 17.3 percent at end-1995.
